title: Understanding and Applying Mathematical Concepts
driving_question: How can we apply mathematical concepts and procedures to solve real-world problems?
short_background_context: The New York State Education Department administers Mathematics Tests annually to assess students' understanding and application of mathematical concepts and procedures. The tests incorporate multiple-choice and constructed-response questions that require students to apply multiple mathematical skills and concepts. Many of these questions are framed within the context of real-world applications or require students to complete multiple steps. This mission is designed to help you better understand these mathematical concepts and apply them to solve problems.
tasks: Analyze and solve multiple-choice questions that assess standard algorithms and conceptual standards.
Complete one-credit constructed-response questions that require multiple steps, assessing procedural skills, conceptual understanding, and application.
Complete two-credit and three-credit constructed-response questions that require you to show your work, apply multiple mathematical skills, and solve real-world applications.
pre_thinking_prompts: What mathematical concepts and procedures do you think will be most important in solving these problems?
How might real-world applications help to contextualize these mathematical concepts?
reflection_prompt: Reflect on your problem-solving process. What strategies were most effective? What concepts did you find most challenging and how did you overcome those challenges?
ai_tutor_prompts: Can you explain why you chose that approach to solve the problem?
How does this concept apply to real-world situations?
What other mathematical concepts could be applied to solve this problem?
remix_zone: Students could remix the problem by creating their own real-world scenarios that require the application of the same mathematical concepts and procedures.
